p: COVID-19 is the sixth global public health emergency in the history as declared by WHO. The two epidemics in recent past, SARS-CoV (2002–2003) and the MERS-CoV (2012–2015), have given us insight into how closely these three manifest, albeit SARS COVID-19 has emerged to be more lethal than the other two [ 1]. These epidemics have taught us to initiate response interventions in the form of early detection, containment, control and mitigation [ 2]. Sadly, there is a dearth of literature from SARS and MERS epidemics on experience and implications in the field of cancer surgery.
